main event: A civilian observed a green fireball in the northeastern sky at 1935 hours MST on 4 December 1949 in Albuquerque, New Mexico.
interesting points: The fireball emitted sparks that varied from orange to white in color., The observation was made by a civilian employee and expert in astronomy., The sighting occurred with no clouds present in the area., The object disappeared behind a building after its appearance., The observer has a reputation for reliability and has assisted the office in previous sightings.
witness description: civilian employee, geodetic engineer, knowledgeable in astronomy
